text: Morning gold along the path, leash a gentle line, Your dog maps scents like stars, drawing routes through time. In my ear a calm AI, whisper-soft and kind, “Prompt the day,” it says, and watch the world align. You say “find,” the shadows organize, Nose to ground, the noise recedes from sight. Fetch the signal, bring it back to me, Nose to data, heart to memory. We walk the model, heel to what is true, Guardrails glitter, city turning blue. Say “fetch,” and watch the day return— Context carried in a loving run. Fetch the signal, we’ll take it home, Tail-wag tokens in a gentle poem. Park benches like datasets, stories in the leaves, You tag the wind with joy, I breathe in what it means. I throw a quiet prompt, you arc across the green— Vector-sniff the path where brighter patterns gleam. If “hallucination squirrels” cross our view, We laugh, re-route, and ground to what is true. Fetch the signal, bring it back to me, Nose to data, heart to memory. We walk the model, heel to what is real, Leash-light guardrails humming like a seal. Say “fetch,” and watch the world return— Every step a page we get to learn. Fetch the signal, we’ll take it home, Love as inference, trust as metronome. If I drift, you tug me back—small feedback loop of care, Your hand in fur, my hand in yours, the app draws lines of air. Treats like caches, saved for later, future learns from now, Three of us—heart, nose, algorithm—keeping gentle vows. Fetch the signal, bring it back to me, Nose to data, heart to memory. We walk the model under rising light, Layered harmonies of pink and white. Say “fetch,” and watch the day return— All we need is what we learn. Fetch the signal, we’re almost home— Patterns, paws, and poems.
